intro: Zosterophyllanthos cardiocrepis, commonly known as the heart-shaped zosterophyllum, is a rare and specialized plant with unique botanical features. It belongs to the order Zosterophyllophyta, which includes ancient marine plants that thrived during the Paleozoic era. The plant exhibits a distinctive morphology with flattened, ribbon-like leaves that resemble those of early land plants. Its reproductive structures are simple and lack the complex vascular systems found in modern plants. Despite its ancient origins, Zosterophyllanthos cardiocrepis is considered a living fossil, offering insights into early plant evolution.
